https://issues.redhat.com/browse/AAP-3456

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Webhook notification retry option
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
We want the websocket notification template to retry the connection to the specified endpoint.  The number of retries and interval time should be user definable.  

Define the value or impact to you or the business
financial impact
active_rfes.issue: We want the websocket notification template to retry the connection to the specified endpoint.  The number of retries and interval time should be user definable.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Extra Vars Need to be Encrypted
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Extra Vars Need to be Encrypted
active_rfes.description:
I am opening this RFE request on behalf of the AaaS team at JPMC; this is a new case cloned from the original case, 03557279

JPMC does not want sensitive data to be transmitted through extra vars for playbook work, i.e., it needs to be hidden from logging, end users, etc.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Notification Template & Credentials
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
Current Process
A scheduled job runs within the JPMC organization
The scheduled job fetches the token from IDAnywhere
The job then uses an admin personal access token to authenticate against the API
Update the notification template “Authorization” header with the token via REST API call

Desired Process
Create an integration with native controller credentials into notification templates. 
We would like to have OAuth credential native in Controller. (GSSAPI+Kerberos as well)
Notification endpoints should have some kind of authentication protection, RH should assume that the notification endpoints have authentication/authorization protected notification endpoint.

Business Impact
This is needed for more standard space and integrates well with the customer’s ecosystem. Solidifies the value of the product. Would require less technical implementation around the box, and allow to leverage AAP more natively within the bank. It helps make the product more pervasive as other companies/firms/customers would benefit from this feature as well. 

Technical Impact
The customer currently injects their OAuth token in clear text inside of the Notification Template. This could cause issues in the future as these fields aren’t currently hashed/encrypted as they are not stored in native AAP credentials.

Scale Impact
This feature is used heavily due to the scale of their environment. In order to reduce API call load we are looking to send as much data out of AAP instead of making calls into the platform. 


Define the value or impact to you or the business
This is needed for more standard space and integrates well with the customer’s ecosystem. Solidifies the value of the product. Would require less technical implementation around the box, and allow to leverage AAP more natively within the bank. It helps make the product more pervasive as other companies/firms/customers would benefit from this feature as well.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Create Inventory and populate inventory in one API call
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Create Inventory and populate inventory in one API call
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
*Current Process*
1. We create inventory via POST to /api/v2/inventory/ (https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Inventories/Inventories_inventories_create)
a. Organization ID is required (INT) to make this API call so additional API call functionality would be needed to pull the organization ID (see RFE# above)
b. Furthermore /api/v2/organizations/{name}
2. We populate inventory POST to /api/v2/bulk/host_create/ (https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Bulk)

*Desired Process*
We can create inventory with an arbitrary list of servers in the initial payload and Ansible Controller will create the inventory containing the provided list of servers.


Define the value or impact to you or the business
*Business Impact*
Less code required to integrate with Ansible controllers into the bank’s ecosystem overall. Less API calls required to create an inventory. Making integration into the ecosystem simpler.

*Technical Impact*
Multiple API calls across multiple deployments of AAP produces unnecessary overhead on the AAP infrastructure for POST of inventory creation and subsequent inventory server population.

*Scale Impact*
Less API calls would be required and less prone to denial of service and performance degradation of the Controller API.

a. Organization ID is required (INT) to make this API call so additional API call functionality would be needed to pull the organization ID (see RFE# above)
b. Furthermore /api/v2/organizations/{name}
2. We populate inventory POST to /api/v2/bulk/host_create/ (https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Bulk)

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Downloading the output of a job in the AAP controller API /api/v2/jobs/<jobid>/stdout needs a download as zip.
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Downloading the output of a job in the AAP controller API /api/v2/jobs/<jobid>/stdout needs a download as zip.
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
For large outputs, we want to AAP controller to support downloading the stdout as a zip file to be more efficient both on network and space requirements.  Currently the only download options supported are txt_download and ansi_download.  We need to something like zip_download format.

Define the value or impact to you or the business
financial impact
active_rfes.issue: For large outputs, we want to AAP controller to support downloading the stdout as a zip file to be more efficient both on network and space requirements.  Currently the only download options supported are txt_download and ansi_download.  We need to something like zip_download format.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Add a method for monitoring uwsgi workers in Controller
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Add a method for monitoring uwsgi workers in Controller
active_rfes.description:
1. What is the nature and description of the request?

While `uwsgitop` can be used to monitor the workers, it requires being logged onto each Controller node to run the command. This RFE would add the ability to monitor the workers from the Controller UI or elsewhere.

2. How would you like to achieve this? (List the functional requirements here)

Having these metrics added to the ./api/v2/metrics endpoint or to a UI element would be ideal.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Make the mesh aware of which execution node can reach which managed nodes
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Make the mesh aware of which execution node can reach which managed nodes
active_rfes.description: I opened this case on behalf of the customer because one of our Red Hat architects confirmed that this RFE would be in line with our current strategy for JPMC

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Request for AAP to accurately report hung receptor service state
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Request for AAP to accurately report hung receptor service state
active_rfes.description:
What is the nature and description of the request?

Desired Process
When the database is experiencing an outage/issue - receptor should reflect this status in the health status shown within API/v2/healthcheck & the topology visualizer.

Current Process
What happens now is the topology visualizer and healthcheck show all nodes as healthy even though in reality receptor service is now in a hung state because the database went offline/online.


Why does the customer need this? (List the business requirements here)

Business Impact
Need this to properly monitor the environment for production executions in a multi cluster environment


Technical Impact
Receptor is hung and gives a false positive to the state of the cluster

Scale Impact
No scaling impact.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Enable API components to be created by names rather than INT value of ID
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Enable API components to be created by names rather than INT value of ID
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
Components that require Organization ID (INT):
Inventory Creation - https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Inventories/Inventories_inventories_create
Credential Creation - https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Credentials/Credentials_credentials_create
Project Creation - https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Projects/Projects_projects_create
Potentially others?


Components that require Instance Group ID (INT):
Launch Job Template - https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Job_Templates/Job_Templates_job_templates_launch_create


Components that require Credential ID (INT):
Launch Job Template - https://docs.ansible.com/automation-controller/latest/html/controllerapi/api_ref.html#/Job_Templates/Job_Templates_job_templates_launch_read

Desired Process
Ansible Controller API components can be created with organization, instance group, and credential names irrespective of the ID value of the organization.


Define the value or impact to you or the business
Business Impact
Less code required to integrate with Ansible controllers into the bank’s ecosystem overall. The bank needs to be able to track these values across 12 disparate clusters and keeping track of the ID’s requires additional code to cache the REF ID for each cluster.

Technical Impact
Multiple API calls across multiple deployments of AAP produces unnecessary overhead on the AAP infrastructure with GETs for REF IDs. Further, the client needs to maintain reference tables for REF IDs across multiple deployment instances.

Scale Impact
Less API calls would be required and less prone to denial of service and performance degradation of the Controller API.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Native Integration of HashiCorp Vault for Secure System Account Management and Encryption Key Storage during Installation
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Native Integration of HashiCorp Vault for Secure System Account Management and Encryption Key Storage during Installation
active_rfes.description:
During the AAP installation process, sensitive data, including system account passwords and encryption keys, are currently handled and stored in plain text. This practice introduces significant security vulnerabilities, including:

Exposure of Credentials: Plain text storage of passwords and encryption keys on disk or during transfer makes them susceptible to unauthorized access, theft, and compromise.

Non-Compliance: This approach may violate internal IBM security policies, industry best practices, and external regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS) that mandate secure handling of sensitive data.

Operational Risk: Manual management of these secrets in plain text increases the risk of human error, leading to potential outages or security breaches.

Lack of Centralized Management: Decentralized and insecure storage hinders auditing, rotation, and lifecycle management of these critical secrets.

Proposed Solution:
Leverage IBM's existing investment in HashiCorp Vault to natively integrate its secrets management capabilities into the AAP installation process. This integration should achieve the following:

Vaulted System Account Passwords: During installation, instead of prompting for or storing system account passwords in plain text, the installer should interact with a pre-configured HashiCorp Vault instance to:

- Retrieve dynamic or static secrets for system accounts (e.g., database users, application users).
- Store newly generated or user-provided system account passwords directly into Vault, if applicable, without ever exposing them in plain text on the filesystem or in logs.
- Facilitate secure injection of these credentials into the application configuration.
- Secure Encryption Key Management: All encryption keys required by the product during installation (e.g., master encryption keys, data encryption keys) must be:
- Generated by or retrieved from HashiCorp Vault.
- Stored exclusively within Vault, with the product accessing them via secure Vault APIs.
- Never stored in plain text on the filesystem or embedded in configuration files.
- Configuration Options: The installer should provide clear configuration options to enable and configure the HashiCorp Vault integration, including:
Vault address (URL)
- Authentication method (e.g., AppRole, Kubernetes, Token) and associated parameters (Role ID, Secret ID, Token).
- Paths for storing and retrieving secrets within Vault.
- Fallback/Manual Mode (Consideration): While Vault integration should be preferred, a documented manual process or limited fallback for environments without Vault access could be considered, with clear warnings about the security implications.

Business Justification / Benefits:

Enhanced Security Posture: Eliminates plain text storage of sensitive credentials, significantly reducing the attack surface and mitigating risks associated with data breaches.

Improved Compliance: Aids in meeting internal IBM security standards and external regulatory requirements for secure secrets management.

Operational Efficiency: Automates the secure handling of credentials, reducing manual effort and potential human error during installation and subsequent operations.

Centralized Secrets Management: Enables administrators to manage, rotate, and audit all product-related secrets from a single, secure HashiCorp Vault instance.

Consistency with IBM Strategy: Aligns with IBM's broader adoption of HashiCorp Vault and promotes a consistent security approach across product portfolios.

Reduced Total Cost of Ownership (TCO): By mitigating security incidents and streamlining operations, this feature can lead to long-term cost savings.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Ability to add execution nodes after the initial install
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Ability to add execution nodes after the initial install
active_rfes.description:
JPMC needs to have this functionality delivered out-of-the box.
In the meantime, Red Hat consulting has provided JPMC a workaround for this issue.

The initial ask is recorded in the parent case, 03802867:

Hao Wu performed the following steps with guidance from the engineering team:
1. Ran the "awx-manage provision_instance --host=<HOST> --node_type=execution" command and that created the instance.
2. Downloaded the install receptor bundle
3. Changed the inventory with the correct user and modified the group_vars/all.yml file to set receptor_listener to false and set the receptor_peers to the controller.
4. Ran the install_receptor.yml and everything went through without issues.
5. But when I check the controller UI I see the instance as unavailable and the error shows "Instance xxx is not in the receptor mesh"
6. Ran the receptorctl command to check the status and the node shows up but I don't see any Known Connections.
7. Ran the receptorctl command to ping the controller from the execution node but get a "ERROR: no route to node" error.

The test was successful after setting receptor_listener to true, and the execution node was added to the mesh.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Add method for atomic creation of AAP content & execution
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Add method for atomic creation of AAP content & execution
active_rfes.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
We need atomic API requests to create then execute job templates and child components ie. projects, credentials & inventory, so that we can simplify the workflow of executing job requests as well as enhance the scalability of AAP platform.
JPMC requires this to run AAP at scale and simplify automation requests to the AAP platform.

Define the value or impact to you or the business
JPMC requires this to run AAP at scale and simplify automation requests to the AAP platform.

We need atomic API requests to create then execute job templates and child components ie. projects, credentials & inventory, so that we can simplify the workflow of executing job requests as well as enhance the scalability of AAP platform.
JPMC requires this to run AAP at scale and simplify automation requests to the AAP platform.

active_rfes.subject: [RFE] Enable AAP Execution Environments to manage credentials where restrictive local regulations apply
active_rfes.summary: [RFE] Enable AAP Execution Environments to manage credentials where restrictive local regulations apply
active_rfes.description: JPMC spoke recently with Richard Henshall about AAP and credentials for restricted environments where these need to be hosted exclusively in those remote environments.  The yellow and green environments attached depict Switzerland and China. The desired process would require that the controller is aware that the execution environment will need to withdraw/gain access to the remote credential immediately prior to the execution.

active_bugs.subject: Ansible Tower 3.8.6 CSRF failed
active_bugs.description:
Describe your problem. Include specific actions and error messages.
Hello folks, we are running Ansible Tower 3.8.6 in production currently and facing an issue for all the users across all type of browser devices recently. When the users try to run any type of ansible job, they run into "CSRF Failed: CSRF token missing or incorrect." We have tried clearing cache, etc and tested on every browser and the error response is consistent. Please advise what we can do further

Describe the impact to you or the business
This is impacting over 200 users for all of the Business as usual ansible automation jobs we have.

In what environment are you experiencing this behavior?
Ansible Tower version 3.8.6

How frequently does this behavior occur? Does it occur repeatedly or at certain times?
This is happening consistently. The curl patch to system API worked only for a while. It goes back to having the error afterwards.
active_bugs.issue: Hello folks, we are running Ansible Tower 3.8.6 in production currently and facing an issue for all the users across all type of browser devices recently. When the users try to run any type of ansible job, they run into "CSRF Failed: CSRF token missing or incorrect." We have tried clearing cache, etc and tested on every browser and the error response is consistent. Please advise what we can do further
active_bugs.periodicityOfIssue: This is happening consistently. The curl patch to system API worked only for a while. It goes back to having the error afterwards.
active_bugs.timeFramesAndUrgency: This is impacting over 200 users for all of the Business as usual ansible automation jobs we have.

active_bugs.subject: DNF RuntimeError: Parsing armored OpenPGP packet(s) failed
active_bugs.summary: DNF RuntimeError: Parsing armored OpenPGP packet(s) failed
active_bugs.description:
Describe your problem. Include specific actions and error messages.
We are seeing this fairly regularly on RHEL 10 beta when we use the yum Ansible module against the remote RHEL 10 system:

01:16:04  TASK [Install jpmc-dnf-config-cli package] *************************************
01:16:08  An exception occurred during task execution. To see the full traceback, use -vvv. The error was: RuntimeError: Parsing armored OpenPGP packet(s) failed
01:16:08  fatal: [fred11482.gielab.jpmchase.net]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "module_stderr": "Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 107, in <module>
  File "<stdin>", line 99, in _ansiballz_main
  File "<stdin>", line 47, in invoke_module
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 226, in run_module
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 98, in _run_module_code
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 88, in _run_code
  File "/tmp/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload_5rd8pg5b/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload.zip/ansible/modules/dnf.py", line 1468, in <module>
  File "/tmp/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload_5rd8pg5b/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload.zip/ansible/modules/dnf.py", line 1457, in main
  File "/tmp/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload_5rd8pg5b/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload.zip/ansible/modules/dnf.py", line 1431, in run
  File "/tmp/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload_5rd8pg5b/ansible_ansible.legacy.dnf_payload.zip/ansible/modules/dnf.py", line 1335, in ensure
  File "/usr/lib/python3.12/site-packages/dnf/base.py", line 2555, in _get_key_for_package
    keys = dnf.crypto.retrieve(keyurl, repo)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib/python3.12/site-packages/dnf/crypto.py", line 137, in retrieve
    keyinfos = rawkey2infos(handle)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib/python3.12/site-packages/dnf/crypto.py", line 127, in rawkey2infos
    keys = libdnf.repo.Key.keysFromFd(key_fo.fileno())
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.12/site-packages/libdnf/repo.py", line 341, in keysFromFd
    return _repo.Key_keysFromFd(fileDescriptor)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: Parsing armored OpenPGP packet(s) failed
", "module_stdout": "", "msg": "MODULE FAILURE
See stdout/stderr for the exact error", "rc": 1}

It seems to relate to:
https://github.com/rpm-software-management/librepo/pull/325
and requires 1.19.0 of librepo for the fix:
https://github.com/rpm-software-management/librepo/releases

Describe the impact to you or the business
breaks engineering automated builds

In what environment are you experiencing this behavior?
lab

How frequently does this behavior occur? Does it occur repeatedly or at certain times?
maybe weekly

           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: Parsing armored OpenPGP packet(s) failed
", "module_stdout": "", "msg": "MODULE FAILURE
See stdout/stderr for the exact error", "rc": 1}

It seems to relate to:
https://github.com/rpm-software-management/librepo/pull/325
and requires 1.19.0 of librepo for the fix:
https://github.com/rpm-software-management/librepo/releases

active_bugs.subject: [BUG] Task stdout escapes quotes twice in Controller API api/v2/jobs/{id}/stdout/?format=txt
active_bugs.summary: [BUG] Task stdout escapes quotes twice in Controller API api/v2/jobs/{id}/stdout/?format=txt
active_bugs.description:
What are you experiencing? What are you expecting to happen?
When retrieving job outputs using the "api/v2/jobs/{id}/stdout/?format=txt" Controller API, we're seeing quote chars being escaped twice.  Instead of the the normal \", we're seeing \\".

When running the same job on the command line using ansible-playbook we're seeing the normal \" as the escape of the stdout of the task.

TASK [Execute tail (with num_of_lines defined)] *******************************************************************************************************************************************************************
changed: [localhost] => {"changed": true, "cmd": "tail --bytes 20480k file_with_quotes.txt", "delta": "0:00:00.006860", "end": "2024-07-02 19:41:29.750997", "msg": "", "rc": 0, "start": "2024-07-02 19:41:29.744137", "stderr": "", "stderr_lines": [], "stdout": "this is a line\n\"this is another line\"", "stdout_lines": ["this is a line", "\"this is another line\""]}

But running through AAP and retrieving the results using the API, we're seeing the double escaped quotes.

Jul  2 14:43:35 iaasn00297571 process-agent: 2024-07-02 14:43:35 EDT | PROCESS | ERROR | (pkg/forwarder/worker.go:183 in process) | Error while processing transaction: error while sending transaction, rescheduling it: Post \\"https://process.datadoghq.com/api/v1/collector\\": Proxy Authentication Required\\n



Define the value or impact to you or the business
This impact our application that retrieves job outputs

Where are you experiencing this behavior? What environment?
All environments

When does this behavior occur? Frequency? Repeatedly? At certain times?
All the time

active_bugs.subject: [BUG] ansible-builder doesn't seem to honor the dns=x.x.x.x flag
active_bugs.summary: [BUG] ansible-builder doesn't seem to honor the dns=x.x.x.x flag
active_bugs.description:
Here's a summary of the issue:

ansible-builder doesn't seem to honor the dns=x.x.x.x flag via the following command:
# ansible-builder build --build-arg dns=169.88.8.8 --build-arg dns=169.88.9.9

Here's the work around:
1. Create the Containerfile so podman/docker can create the image via
    # ansible-builder create

2. Run podman build to build the image:
    # podman build -f context/Containerfile --dns=169.88.8.8 --dns=169.88.9.9

active_bugs.subject: [RFE] PostgreSQL Password Encryption and HashiCorp Vault Integration
active_bugs.summary: [RFE] PostgreSQL Password Encryption and HashiCorp Vault Integration
active_bugs.description:
Describe your problem. Include specific actions and error messages.
Automation hub doesn't provide a way to meet bank security standards around password encryption. Unlike other parts of AAP, Automation Hub specifically Pulp does not cache the password which would allow remote storage and encryption. To meet parity within the product, the customer is requesting that the password is cached so that remote sources for encryption can be used. Ideally the customer would like to see native integration between HashiCorp Vault and AAP for internal AAP secret management of Postgres

Describe the impact to you or the business
This affects the auditibility, and security and controls of the application within the customers environment.

In what environment are you experiencing this behavior?
All environments

How frequently does this behavior occur? Does it occur repeatedly or at certain times?
All the time
